thread.title: Liverpool team news: Jordan Henderson injury rules him out of Leicester clash | Metro News
thread.title_full: Liverpool team news: Jordan Henderson injury rules him out of Leicester clash | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Liverpool team news: Jordan Henderson injury rules him out of Leicester clash | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 12:34 pm Jordan Henderson is out of Liverpool’s clash with Leicester City (Picture: Getty) 
Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson has been ruled out of tonight’s clash with Leicester City with a foot injury. 
The England midfielder sustained the problem in training over the weekend and will miss the Reds’ game at the KingPower stadium. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
Henderson feared a much greater injury lay-off after sustaining the hit but he’s also expected to miss the huge game against Arsenal at Anfield on Saturday. 
Jurgen Klopp’s side are entering a crucial period with key matches against Everton, Manchester City and the Gunners in the next month. Henderson could also miss the Arsenal game (Picture: Getty) 
Henderson, who has made 28 appearances for the Reds this term, is likely to be replaced by Germany international Emre Can against the Foxes. 
Klopp recently took his side on a team-bonding trip to La Manga as the Reds had been knocked out of the FA Cup. 
Elsewhere, Daniel Sturridge is a doubt for the clash after struggling with a virus in recent days while Dejan Lovren is 50/50 with a knee injury.
